description:
Foreign key constraints are not enabled in sqlite.
It is impossible to write tests that involve foreign key constraints.
title: Foreign keys are not enabled in sqlite

comments.content: Foreign key constraints are not enabled in sqlite
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~eyerediskin

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/32860
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content: Keep in mind that old versions of SQLite don't do foreign key constraints correctly with SQLAlchemy.  So you need the version check that's in test_db_api.py
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~dripton

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/33620
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
This isn't a bug report, it's a statement.

What exactly needs them FKs to be enabled? How has this come up? How does the bug manifest itself? etc.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~markmc
